intro: Tithymalus zeravschanicus, commonly known as the Pamir tithymale, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained, rocky soils. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in high-altitude meadows. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species within its native range.
